intro: Crambe cordifolia subvar. palmatifida, commonly known as the broad-leaved crambe, is a perennial herb native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are often deeply lobed and resemble a palmate structure, giving it its subspecies name. The plant produces yellow flowers in racemes, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are used in traditional herbal remedies for their purported medicinal properties.
